snippet: After the Republican-controlled New York Senate declined to consider a health insurance exchange, the governor issued an executive order to create it within the State Health Department.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo steps into national debate over health care reform, offering an enthusiastic endorsement of the law's benefits and issuing an executive order to establish a health insurance exchange in New York; order will create an online marketplace offering choice of competing health insurance plans, a measure the Republican majority in the State Senate has refused to consider.
lead_paragraph: After the Republican-controlled New York Senate declined to consider a health insurance exchange, the governor issued an executive order to create it within the State Health Department.

headline.seo: Cuomo Orders Health Insurance Exchange in New York
headline.main: Cuomo Acts to Advance Health Law in New York
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Acts To Advance Health Law In New York

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
